etymologies: French, literally ‘touched’, past participle of toucher

definitions: used as an acknowledgment during a discussion of a good or clever point made at one's expense by another person

examples.text: “You haven't contributed much, this evening.” “How could I have?” “Touché. I do go on.”

shortDefinitions: used as acknowledgement of good or clever point

definitions: (in fencing) used as an acknowledgment of a hit by one's opponent.
shortDefinitions: (in fencing) used as acknowledgement of hit by one's opponent
